facts.text: Shrek's movements were modeled after a professional bulldog.
Chris Farley originally recorded nearly all of Shrek's dialogue before he passed away.
The movie is credited with saving DreamWorks from bankruptcy.
There is a real psychological condition named after the movie called 'The Truman Show Delusion'.
The film was originally going to be a dark sci-fi thriller set in a recreated New York City.
Jim Carrey took a pay cut just to show he could do dramatic acting.
Johnny Depp based Jack Sparrow on a mix of Keith Richards and the cartoon skunk Pepe Le Pew.
Keira Knightley felt she didn't deserve the role and packed only enough for a few days, expecting to be fired.
It was the first movie under the Disney brand to be rated PG-13.
E.T.'s face was modeled after poet Carl Sandburg, Albert Einstein, and a pug.
Steven Spielberg shot the film in chronological order so the child actors' emotional goodbyes at the end would be real.
Harrison Ford filmed a cameo as the school principal, but it was cut.
Oscar the Grouch was originally orange, not green.
Cookie Monster's real name is Sid.
It is the most widely viewed children's program in the world, broadcast in over 120 countries.
The title refers to the reflection you see on a powered-off screen (phone, TV, monitor).
Episodes are often set in the same universe, with Easter eggs linking them together.
Stephen King is a huge fan of the show.
Will Smith only agreed to do the show because he was in massive debt to the IRS.
The taxi driver in the opening credits is actually Quincy Jones.
Alfonso Ribeiro invented the 'Carlton Dance' by parodying Courteney Cox in the 'Dancing in the Dark' video.
The game was designed to attract women to arcades because it wasn't violent.
Each ghost has a specific AI personality: Blinky chases, Pinky ambushes, Inky is unpredictable, and Clyde acts stupid.
The highest possible score is 3,333,360.
Sonic was originally a rabbit that could pick up objects with its ears.
He is blue solely to match the Sega logo.
Michael Jackson was involved in composing the music for Sonic 3 but went uncredited.
A plague in the game (Corrupted Blood incident) was studied by epidemiologists to understand how real-world viruses spread.
At its peak, the game had a population larger than the country of Belgium.
Robin Williams was a huge fan and has a tribute character in the game.
A species of horse fly with a golden butt was named after her (Scaptia beyonceae).
She runs while singing on a treadmill to build lung capacity for concerts.
She was the first female artist to have her first six studio albums debut at number one.
He wrote a song literally titled 'Leck mich im Arsch' (Lick me in the arse) as a party joke.
He could listen to a full song once and write it down perfectly from memory.
He had a pet starling that could sing the theme of his Piano Concerto No. 17.
Keith Richards wrote the riff for '(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction' in his sleep and recorded it on a bedside tape deck.
The band name comes from a Muddy Waters song.
They have performed together for over 60 years.
It is illegal to handle a salmon in suspicious circumstances (Salmon Act 1986).
It is technically treason to place a postage stamp bearing the monarch's head upside down.
You are not allowed to wear a suit of armor in Parliament.
In Arizona, it is illegal for a donkey to sleep in a bathtub.
In Alabama, it is illegal to drive while blindfolded.
In Vermont, a woman must get her husband's written permission to wear false teeth.
Bubble wrap was originally invented to be 3D textured wallpaper.
The microwave was invented when a radar engineer noticed a chocolate bar melted in his pocket.
Potato chips were created by a chef trying to annoy a customer who kept sending his fries back.
Play-Doh was originally a wallpaper cleaner to remove coal soot.
The first vending machine was invented in Ancient Egypt to dispense holy water.
Romans had a form of concrete that is actually stronger and more durable than modern concrete.
The first battery (Baghdad Battery) might have existed 2,000 years ago.
The sentence 'Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo' is grammatically correct.
A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
The dot over the letter 'i' or 'j' is called a 'tittle'.
'Queue' is the only word that is pronounced the same way when the last four letters are removed.
'Tsundoku' (Japanese): Buying books and piling them up without reading them.
'Backpfeifengesicht' (German): A face that is begging to be slapped.
'Sobremesa' (Spanish): The time spent talking at the table after a meal is over.
The 'Baader-Meinhof Phenomenon' is when you learn a new word and suddenly start seeing it everywhere.
Your brain treats rejection like physical pain.
Memories are easily manipulated; if you are asked 'How fast was the car going when it *smashed*?' vs '*hit*?', you recall higher speeds.
The 'Doorway Effect' is why you forget what you were doing when you walk into a new room.
Unicorns are mentioned in the King James Bible, but it's likely a mistranslation of a wild ox.
In original folklore, fairies were often malicious pranksters, not cute Tinkerbells.
The Kraken was likely based on sightings of giant squids.
Loki once turned himself into a female horse, got pregnant, and gave birth to an eight-legged horse.
Athena was born fully grown and armored out of Zeus's forehead.
Egyptian god Anubis weighed hearts against a feather to decide who entered the afterlife.
They glow bio-fluorescent green under UV light.
They don't have stomachs.
Males have venomous spurs on their hind legs.
When scientists first saw a platypus, they thought it was a fake animal sewn together.
Crows hold grudges and can teach their children to hate specific humans.
They sometimes leave 'gifts' like buttons or shiny glass for humans who feed them.
Ravens can mimic human speech better than some parrots.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped so it doesn't roll away.
Their butts are armored with cartilage to crush predators' skulls against the roof of their burrows.
Cheese is the most stolen food in the world.
Mice actually prefer sweet foods like fruit or grain over cheese.
Casu Marzu is a Sardinian cheese containing live maggots (and it's illegal in many places).
The world's most expensive coffee (Kopi Luwak) comes from beans digested and pooped out by a civet cat.
Voltaire reportedly drank 40 to 50 cups of coffee a day.
Coffee was nearly banned in 17th-century England because women complained it made their husbands useless.
You produce enough saliva in your lifetime to fill two swimming pools.
Demodex mites live in your eyelashes and come out at night to mate on your face.
Your stomach lining replaces itself every few days so it doesn't digest itself.
Humans are the best long-distance runners in the animal kingdom; we can outrun horses in a marathon.
Your liver is the only organ that can completely regenerate itself.
If uncoiled, the DNA in all your cells would stretch to the sun and back hundreds of times.
There is an island in Brazil (Snake Island) so dangerous the government banned visitors.
North Sentinel Island is home to a tribe that has rejected all contact with the modern world.
Vulcan Point is an island in a lake on an island in a lake on an island.
The Vatican City has the highest crime rate per capita in the world (mostly pickpockets).
Istanbul is the only major city located on two continents (Europe and Asia).
There is a town in Norway called 'Hell' that freezes over every winter.
Steve Buscemi was a firefighter and returned to his old firehouse to help during 9/11.
Christopher Walken used to be a lion tamer in a circus.
Danny DeVito was a beautician and hairstylist before acting.
Hugh Jackman used to be a PE teacher (and once recognized a student on the red carpet).
Hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia is the fear of long words.
Anatidaephobia is the fear that somewhere, somehow, a duck is watching you.
Pogonophobia is the fear of beards.
Nomophobia is the fear of being without your mobile phone.
